data.title: Cuarto de hotel (1953)
data.meta_description: Newlywed couple move from small town to Mexico City. Their first night in the city, they get separated by accident, and it takes them 90 minutes and lots of incidents before they find each other again.
data.text:
One of those Murphy's Law melodramas where anything bad that can happen, will. Done with occasional bursts of florid expressionist energy, but mostly not very special. I've read that the screenwriter hoped to get Bunuel to direct it; I'm surprised anybody recognized Bunuel as a prestige figure in 1952, and I wonder what the writer thought he had here that was worthy of L.B.'s attention...

... but now I understand that drawn-out scene where Roberto Ca√±edo helps Lilia Prado take off her shoes and stockings, and that whole subplot involving a pair of Prado's shoes... yep, makes perfect sense now.

PS: Film #4000, give or take X number of titles I don't remember. Yippee.
